definition: exegesis/explanation of classic text
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing

sentences.english: This is the glory of expository preaching, we were told.
sentences.chinese: 有人說，這是釋經講道的榮耀。

sentences.english: However, I'm not in complete agreement with all of the exegesis that stands behind that statement.
sentences.chinese: 不過，我對這個陳述背後的釋經，並不完全同意。

definition: old variant of 補缺|补缺[bu3 que1]
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
order of arrangement
to check and correct
to be in overall charge/to oversee
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
to know how to count and do sums/numerate/numeracy
difficulty/degree of difficulty or ease
commentary and subcommentary (of a book)
The School Sayings of Confucius (abbr. for 孔子家語|孔子家语[Kong3 zi3 Jia1 yu3])
quintessence/essentials
to observe the ritual mourning
study of classic texts, including interpretation, glossaries and commentaries
expedient
lit. carpenter's straight line marker/same as 墨斗/fig. rules/rules and regulations
